title: Emotion-Based Simulation Training for Cultivating Anti-Racist Science Teachers in K-12 Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science education methodologies, multicultural education concepts, and basic understanding of social inequality
context.additional_context: A process where pre-service teachers cultivate reflective practice by experiencing race-related scenarios in science subjects through VR simulations.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze racial discrimination cases in science classes within VR environments and document/reflect on personal emotional responses
Learners can recognize unconscious biases and develop anti-racist action plans using simulation feedback systems
Learners can collaboratively develop three or more anti-racist strategies applicable to science education settings through reflective dialogue with peers

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
